title.narrative: Build Indonesia to Take Care of Nature for Sustainability "BIJAK" Project

description.narrative: (Indonesia): Indonesia is one of the most biologically diverse countries in the world, boasting significant forest, marine, mineral, and freshwater resources which directly support the livelihoods of millions of Indonesians and provide critical ecosystem services. Due to weak governance, however, these ecosystems are threatened by loss of forest and wildlife resources. To address these challenges, USAID, through BIJAK, works at the national level with a range of stakeholders to improve the management of forests and conservation areas and to strengthen the protections for marine and terrestrial wildlife to reduce illegal or unsustainable trade....Through.training, mentoring, and capacity building, USAID develops self-sufficient.Indonesian organizations that promote policies and regulations which conserve.and sustainably manage natural resources. USAID also builds the capacity of the.Indonesian government to reduce wildlife crime and the domestic demand for.wildlife and their products through behavior change campaigns that catalyzes public.constituencies for conservation. USAID strengthens the policy and regulatory frameworks to reduce.encroachment into biodiversity hotspots and to protect areas of high.conservation value. USAID increases the effectiveness of.partnerships between local communities and protected area managers to.better conserve biologically diverse and carbon-rich ecosystems and more sustainably.use natural resources. Effective natural resource management by the Government of Indonesia positively contributes to its long-term economic prosperity and USAID's work in this area contributes to the Indo Pacific Strategy to improve natural resources management and to the U.S. Mission objective of supporting Indonesia's greater global and regional role promoting democratic values, rule of law, protecting the environment, public health, and other shared priorities. ...
